title: Data feminism
author: Catherine D'Ignazio and Lauren F. Klein

title: Technology is Not Neutral - A Short Guide to Data Ethics
author: Stephanie Hare

title: The Checklist Manifesto
author: Atul Gawande
details: Senior Information Analyst at NHS Lothian
Description: It's basically a sell on how to design checklists that other people will use, making sure they're 100% completing tasks and documenting that they're doing them properly. It's an easy read, the writer is a surgeon so there's some medical examples of applications which is fun. Was definitely valuable while I was in research, some folk might find it interesting.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
details: a healthcare scientist at Public Health Scotland
Description: "This is a twin recommendation for two books by Yuval Noah Harari
column7: titled 'Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind' and 'Homo Deus: A Brief History of Tomorrow
column8: ' are essential reading for healthcare personnel
column9: as we can provide clearer insights into humanity
column11: interpretation of habits and the physical and mental health of community."

title: Technofeudalism
author: Yaris Varoufakis
details: a Senior Information Analyst at NHS Lothian
Description: "Together with the older book The Age of Surveillance Capitalism by Shoshana Zubroff. Thinking about how data and the technological companies are shaping the world around us economically and politically is important. Even if you don't agree with everything Varoufakis says it is an interesting  perspective that bears consideration."

title: Never Split The Difference
details: Project Office Team Manager at Public Health Scotland
